alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Faulk; Potter (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 20 at 4:08PM MST until February 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST /11 PM MST/ TONIGHT TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ MONDAY TO 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Dewey, Potter and Faulk Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ Monday to 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight CST /11 PM MST/ tonight to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may fall at times tonight into Monday morning, but accumulations are expected to be light.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
